message: That sounds amazing, I want it!
I'm looking for a project that checks django code and templates for badness. What's out there?
Also it looks like it hasn't had any attention since July https://github.com/lamby/django-lint
I've found django-lint, to me it looks quite ugly and it doesn't do templates (which is the main thing I want it for)
its called reading the code :)
I looked for something like this a couple months ago and I did not find anything. So +1 to @alex :-)
If not maybe I'll have to fork django-lint and add it myself
I'd use this if it existed. I'd also write emacs integration for it.
@alex sure, but you've got to admit, tools that check this stuff make human error less likely... pyflakes for instance is basically a must-have for code cleanup. I run it as a git pre-commit hook

Stuff in templates I'd like to check:
 - syntax errors / undefined tags
 - unescaped entities embedded in html templates
 - unnecessary {% load %} blocks
 - broken includes
 - include loops
 - bad block hierarchy (causing template parts to get ignored)
 - stuff outside of blocks in child templates
 - empty / unused blocks
 - unused templates (possible? maybe not)
I've been using this PyFlakes bundle for TextMate by David Cramer http://justcramer.com/2010/11/30/integrating-pyflakes-into-textmate/
Pretty sure looking for unused templates would be a minor variant of the halting problem :)
@arthurcase yeah, I've seen that, quite handy. I'm already using pyflakes though, wondering if there's something higher level that checks django-specific badness. Especially templates...
Yeah you're not going to be able to do that analysis statically
ok so as @alex says, static checking is probably out. So I guess this should be a separate project from django-lint (which is a static checker)
django-lint author here. Static checking of templates is pretty much impossible unfortunately.
We should totally integrate django-lint into the textmate bundle
That could work :)
django-vacuum
I'm starting work on a non-static template checker. No promises if or when it'll be usable...
Need a good name. django-templatechecker seems a little verbose
django-tc?
@airstrike +1
Here's a start: https://github.com/craigds/django-vacuum . I'd appreciate any help adding rules and stuff to make it awesome :) It works right now but only checks for a few things
@airstrike +2 - done :)

@craigds can it be executed from the command line without pluging it into the django config files? For me it's important to run something like this from within a test suite, which could be run onto multiple projects. I can make sure that the proper environment (e.g. virtualenv with all eggs) has been loaded, but the checker should be runnable from there on.
@theblacklion yep good plan https://github.com/craigds/django-vacuum/issues/3
